intro: Memecylon steenisii, commonly known as the African memecylon, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or yellowish flowers and opposite, ovate leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and understoreys. Memecylon steenisii is often found in swampy areas and is adapted to thrive in high humidity and wet conditions.
